meanings.definition: A person or business that sells goods directly to consumers.
meanings.sent1: The local retailor always has the latest fashion trends in stock.
meanings.sent2: I bought this dress from a retailor in the mall.
meanings.sent3: The retailor joked that they could sell ice to polar bears.
meanings.sent4: She was a retailor of happiness, spreading joy with every sale.
meanings.sent5: The retailor's shop was a colorful paradise for shoppers.

meanings.definition: To sell goods in small quantities directly to consumers.
meanings.sent1: She decided to retailor handmade jewelry online.
meanings.sent2: The farmer chose to retailor his produce at the local market.
meanings.sent3: He tried to retailor his old toys but found no takers.
meanings.sent4: The artist retailored her paintings to suit the new gallery's theme.
meanings.sent5: They retailor their products with care and attention to detail.

meanings.definition: The act of selling goods in small quantities directly to consumers.
meanings.sent1: Retailor is an essential part of the economy.
meanings.sent2: The retailor of handmade soaps had a loyal customer base.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about retailor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, retailor plays a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The art of retailor requires good marketing skills.
